page.title: 13STUDLEY,WARWICKSHIRE
page.content: Studley is one of the most populous villages in the whole country.It is situated on the Alcester-Birmingham road,called Ryknild St.from. Roman times.It is just on the Warwickshire side of the Worcs./Warks. border and this has fostered an aversion to being swallowed up in any extension of the Redditch New Town area,which has crept ever nearer to the border. It is an old village,though it does not look to be so in most areas.There is a Norman nave in the church of "The Nativity of Our Lady" and medieval rood stairs.There are the gabled Castle Cottages near the church.Most of the village,however,consists of what appears to be between-the-wars housing estates.It is nearly self contained-there are schools for every age and all main services plus a recreation ground & swimming pool.
